00151 void loadOrganizedData(const std::string &filename, const unsigned id, const unsigned od, Array<double> &in, Array<double> &out) {
00152   Array<double> raw;
00153   unsigned i, c;
00154 
00155         std::ifstream dataFile(filename.c_str());
00156   if(!dataFile) {
00157                 std::cerr << "cannot open data file " << filename << std::endl;
00158     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00159   }
00160   readArray(raw, dataFile);
00161   dataFile.close();
00162 
00163   // if someone wants to learn just a single pattern...
00164   if(raw.ndim() == 1) {
00165     Array<double> dummy = raw;
00166     raw.resize(1, dummy.nelem());
00167     raw[0] = dummy;
00168   }
00169 
00170   out.resize(raw.dim(0), od);
00171   in.resize(raw.dim(0), id);
00172   for(i = 0; i < raw.dim(0); i++) {
00173     for(c = 0; c < id; c++)
00174       in(i, c) = raw(i, c);
00175     for(c = 0; c < od; c++)
00176       out(i, c) = raw(i, id + c);
00177   }
00178 }
